results.title: Earthworms: nature's soil builders
results.brief_description: Describes the structure of earthworms and explains how earthworms are adapted to living underground. Presents simple experiments that can be duplicated in the classroom. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.description: Describes the structure of earthworms and explains how earthworms are adapted to living underground. Presents simple experiments that can be duplicated in the classroom. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Earthworms
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling and Pat Dowling Pictures
results.brief_description: Shows the life cycle of the earthworm and gives detailed information on its habits. Explains its value in digesting plant food to enrich the soil. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Shows the life cycle of the earthworm and gives detailed information on its habits. Explains its value in digesting plant food to enrich the soil. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Earthworms
results.brief_description: The earthworm is dissected and its muscular, nervous, digestive and reproductive systems are examined; the bisexual reproductive process is shown, and the emergence of a young earthworm completes the life cycle study. The importance of earthworms in aerating and enriching the soil is stressed.
results.description: The earthworm is dissected and its muscular, nervous, digestive and reproductive systems are examined; the bisexual reproductive process is shown, and the emergence of a young earthworm completes the life cycle study. The importance of earthworms in aerating and enriching the soil is stressed.

results.title: Earthworm: anatomy and dissection
results.brief_description: Stresses correct laboratory techniques for dissection, showing a close look at the digestive, circulatory, excretory, nervous, and reproductive systems of the earthworm. Shows functioning of these systems by means of extreme close-up photography, photomicrography and diagrams.

results.title: Earthquakes: lesson of a disaster
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Documents the social and physical aftermath of two earthquakes, a major one in Turkey and a smaller one in California. The film shows the effects of both earthquakes on buildings and the surrounding landscape. The problems of how to cope with such a disaster are also shown. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Earthquakes and volcanoes. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates how volcanoes and earthquakes occur in the same place in certain regions of the world. It suggests that they have a common cause: the friction and collision between the plates in motion which cover the earth’s surface. Suitable for secondary level.
results.description: This film demonstrates how volcanoes and earthquakes occur in the same place in certain regions of the world. It suggests that they have a common cause: the friction and collision between the plates in motion which cover the earth’s surface. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Earthquakes and volcanoes
results.brief_description: The forces that cause earthquakes and volcanoes. Wherever the earth has been folded up into mountains, cracks may appear in the crust. When blocks of earth move along these cracks, or faults, earthquakes may occur. If melted rock is near a fault or weak spot in the crust, it may be forced out to produce a volcanic eruption.

results.title: Earthquake
results.creator_credit: Film Associates and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Uses animation to demonstrate how an earthquake takes place. Shows the effects of earthquakes on landforms and on man-made structures. Explains how scientists learn more about earthquakes by studying the vibrations produced. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Earth satellites: explorers of outer space
results.brief_description: Scenes at the Army and Navy launching site show satellites being built, prepared for launching and taking off. Uses animated drawings to explain why satellites stay in orbit, how orbits may vary, and how information is received from satellites. Includes a sequence describing things to come in the space age.
